body_html: yeah I've seen another case like this in kubernetes, where commits that were already reviewed and merge into one branch are simply being cherry-picked over to a different branch. In these cases, you are much more likely to get into a "need author consent" state. At the time, someone had suggested checking to see if the commit was already in the repo in a different branch, which might be possible. I've cc'ed you on the internal bug.
